metadata.titel_preek: Our Walk: The Freedom of Submission

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transition of the human soul from the 'alien environment' of self-enslavement (Western freedom) to the 'liberating restrictions' of God's design (Christian freedom).

tekstueel_bewijs: "True Christian spiritual freedom: what it is, what it brings, and how it can grow in you."
"so that you and I could be free"
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies primarily with the Subject who must 'jump back into the water'.

helper.identificatie: The Cross/Christ's Example and the Act of Promising
tekstueel_bewijs: "look at Jesus Christ on the cross"
helper.rol_van_god: God/Christ is primarily the Helper (Adjuvant) who provides the model and the motivation for the Subject's freedom.
helper.rol_van_geest: Absent; the focus is on the Subject's cognitive shift and willpower.

tekstueel_bewijs: "The Western definition of freedom is basically selfishness."
"the culture tells us... we have trouble understanding it ourselves."
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily a 'misunderstanding' or a 'cultural mindset' that needs to be corrected by better information.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Soteriological Program: Christ losing his freedom to free the sinner.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Jesus Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon uses the Soteriological Program (Christ's work) as a motivational fuel for the Primary Program (Human growth in freedom).

voorbeelden_god_subject: "Jesus Christ lost all the infinite freedom he had"
voorbeelden_mens_subject: "we’ve been looking at how we live"
"you need to grow in this freedom"

voorbeelden: "what it is, what it brings, and how it can grow in you"
"This statement makes no sense unless you recognize two assumptions."
"Let’s take a look and see what we can pull out."

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is highly intellectual/didactic. It assumes that if the hearer understands the 'logic' of freedom (Savoir), they will be motivated (Vouloir) to act (Performance).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Autonomy) through ~S1 (Rebellion) to ~S2 (Commitment) and finally S1 (Submission).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by redefining 'Slave' as the only way to be 'Free'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; S2 is treated as a category error rather than a state of spiritual death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon ends with the Cross, the narrative structure is largely 'How-To' (Anthropocentric). God is the Designer and Christ is the Motivator, but the Hearer is the primary Subject of the 'Walk'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: "If you trust him, you’ll get into the Christian freedom."

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: "Jesus Christ lost all the infinite freedom he had so that you and I could be free."

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Christ is presented as the 'attitude' to be armed with and the 'model' of restricted freedom.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ as the one who submits *for* us because we cannot, rather than Christ as the one we must look at to learn how to submit.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'grow' and 'make promises' to achieve freedom.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is viewed as a cognitive/volitional process of the human subject.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'logic of freedom' to the 'cross' feels slightly tacked on as a motivational tool rather than the source of the power.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God's mighty hand' (Grace) and 'Make promises' (Human effort).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: "I must see him torn... trust him, you'll get into the Christian freedom."

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on 'Savoir-faire' (knowledge) rather than the Spirit's 'Pouvoir-faire' (power).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is described as 'selfishness' and 'misunderstanding freedom'—a design flaw rather than a cosmic rebellion.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'user manual' for the soul. The hearer is the Subject, and God is the Consultant/Designer.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one who must 'jump back into the water'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the one who 'throws the fish back into the water'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You must jump back into the water,' use 'The God of all grace has caught you in your gasping and plunged you back into His life.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Receiver' of God's promise.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on God's faithfulness as the only reason our promises have any weight.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize 1 Peter 5:10: 'God... will HIMSELF restore you'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: The Devil (mentioned in text but ignored in sermon).
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'culture', we just need better education. If the opponent is the 'Roaring Lion', we need a Savior-Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (how to grow) precedes Soteriology (the cross).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Establish the 'God who restores' (Program 1) before the 'Walk of submission' (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is brilliant in its cultural analysis and logic, but it risks turning the Gospel into a 'superior philosophy of life' where the hearer remains the primary actor.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the 'fish' illustration; Greimas reveals that the illustration makes the hearer the Subject of the 'jump'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains 1 Peter; Greimas shows that the sermon's 'engine' is fueled by human growth rather than divine restoration.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'looking at the cross' is used here as a modal competence (motivation) for the human subject rather than a finished act of the Divine Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Gospel-centered moralism'—it uses Gospel themes to power a moral/growth-oriented narrative.
